sub_title: Technical Consultant @ Plat4mation | Data Scientist | Electrical & Computer Engineer
summary:
Data enthusiast and Electrical & Computer Engineer, I am currently advancing my expertise with a Master's in Data Science for Decision Making at Maastricht University. My fervor for uncovering innovative solutions and harnessing the power of data drives me to excel in data mining, data fusion, computer vision, and software engineering, ensuring strategic decisions and impactful results.

Throughout my academic and professional journey, I've gained diverse experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, and Teaching Assistant. This has refined my skills in data structures, algorithms, numerical mathematics, and databases, while sharpening my ability to collaborate and build meaningful relationships with colleagues, students, and stakeholders.

As a committed lifelong learner, I continually seek opportunities to grow and apply my skills in data science, machine learning, and cutting-edge computer engineering technologies. I'm eager to connect with fellow data aficionados and industry professionals, so don't hesitate to reach out or connect with me for stimulating discussions and potential collaborations.

projects.title: Data Fusion Project
projects.description:
‣ Utilized various data fusion techniques to optimize classification performance of 1k images.

‣ Performed computer vision for feature extraction from images, using Python and Jupyter Notebooks.

‣ Conducted low-level, mid-level, and high-level (decision) fusion.

‣ Collaborated with team members using Google Colaboratory to develop and implement the project.

This project allowed me to deepen my skills in computer vision, data fusion, and Python programming. By integrating multiple data sources and applying various data fusion techniques, we were able to optimize the classification performance of images. The collaborative nature of this project provided me with valuable experience in teamwork and project management.

Environment: Python, Jupyter Notebooks, Google Colaboratory

contributors.headline: Technical Consultant @ Plat4mation | Data Scientist | Electrical & Computer Engineer

projects.title: EURO 2021 prediction
projects.description:
‣Built a database from scratch by combining different data sources into one dataset, using Python and SQL.

‣Applied various machine learning techniques to predict the winner of the UEFA European Football Championship 2021.

‣Developed research questions to identify the main characteristics of a winning or losing team and the most influential attributes of a good or bad player.

‣Used Python and various machine learning models to predict the outcome of one match and explored methods for predicting the outcome of a tournament.

‣Gained valuable experience in machine learning, data analysis, database management, and Python programming.

This project allowed me to develop my skills in machine learning, data analysis, database management, and Python programming, while also providing me with the opportunity to apply these skills to a real-world problem. By building a database and applying machine learning techniques, we were able to predict the outcome of the UEFA European Football Championship 2021 with a high degree of accuracy. Additionally, we developed research questions to identify the main characteristics of a winning or losing team and the most influential attributes of a good or bad player, which helped to refine our machine learning models.

contributors.headline: Technical Consultant @ Plat4mation | Data Scientist | Electrical & Computer Engineer

projects.title: An analysis of COVID-19 vaccine sentiments and opinions on Twitter
projects.description:
‣ Conducted sentiment analysis on tweets related to COVID-19 vaccines, focusing on pharmaceuticals like Moderna, Pfizer, Sinovac, and others.

‣ Preprocessed tweets using natural language processing techniques and performed sentiment analysis using Bidirectional LSTM.

‣ Presented public opinion and sentiments with visualizations, including topics, text scatter-plots with most common words, Geo-Location of tweets, Sankey Diagrams, and stream graphs.

‣ Analyzed vaccine timelines with event detection techniques.

‣ Gained valuable experience in natural language processing, sentiment analysis, data visualization, and event detection.

This project allowed me to develop my skills in natural language processing, sentiment analysis, data visualization, and event detection, while also providing me with the opportunity to apply these skills to a real-world problem. By analyzing tweets related to COVID-19 vaccines, we were able to gain insights into public sentiment and opinions, as well as vaccine timelines. Additionally, we used a variety of visualizations to present our findings in an accessible and informative way.

contributors.headline: Technical Consultant @ Plat4mation | Data Scientist | Electrical & Computer Engineer

projects.title: METHODOLOGIES AND MACHINE LEARNING TECHNIQUES FOR SYSTEMATIC SURVEYS OF BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE LITERATURE
projects.description:
‣Conducted a literature survey in the field of business intelligence, collecting 305 papers using Google Scholar and related keywords.

‣Complemented existing surveys by identifying publications from 2007 to 2018 and classifying them based on nine research strategies and various research topic categories.

‣Applied machine learning techniques to assess the relevance of the papers with the business intelligence field and increase the accuracy of classification.

‣Results showed that most of the papers appeared in 2015 and 2017, and the majority addressed formal theory and/or reviews and belonged to the "benefits" research topic category.

‣Utilized SVM polynomial and neural networks with ROSE sampling on 80% of the original data using the "TDM" and "Topic" feature spaces to obtain the best classification results.

‣Published in a scientific journal.

This project allowed me to contribute to the academic community through the publication of our findings in a scientific journal. By conducting a comprehensive literature survey and applying machine learning techniques to assess the relevance of the papers with the business intelligence field, we were able to provide insights into the current state of research in the field. This project also provided me with valuable experience in academic research and scientific writing.

profile_positions.description:
As a teaching assistant, I provided support for Data Structures and Algorithms, Numerical Mathematics, Calculus, and Databases courses for Bachelor students in the Department of Advanced Computing Sciences (DACS) at Maastricht University. I also assisted in teaching Linear Algebra for the Maastricht Science Programme (MSP) and Calculus and Linear Algebra for Business Engineering (BE).

In this role, I prepared and led tutorial sessions, assisted with grading and assessments. I leveraged my expertise in data structures, algorithms, and numerical mathematics to help students develop a deep understanding of the course material. I also cultivated strong relationships with faculty, staff, and students, fostering a positive and supportive learning environment.

Through my experience as a teaching assistant, I have developed strong communication and interpersonal skills, as well as the ability to explain complex concepts in an accessible way. I am passionate about education and believe that everyone has the potential to excel with the right support and guidance.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
●Conducted research and data analysis to inform the development of algorithms and services for routing optimization for logistic companies.

●Provided support in user training seminars, assisting in the onboarding of new users and helping them to understand and utilize the services offered.

●Supported contacts with users and data providers, ensuring that strong relationships were maintained with partners.

●Participated in software design and development for an intelligent research infrastructure for shipping, supply chain, transport, and logistics.

In this role, I had the opportunity to conduct research and data analysis to inform the development of algorithms and services for routing optimization for logistic companies. By providing support in user training seminars and maintaining strong relationships with partners, I was able to ensure successful adoption and usage of these services. Additionally, I participated in software design and development for an intelligent research infrastructure for shipping, supply chain, transport, and logistics. My experience in research, data analysis, and software development has equipped me with a strong foundation to leverage data to drive business success.
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Intelligent Research Infrastructure for Shipping, Supply Chain, Transport and Logistics (EN.I.R.I.S.S.T.) is a unique and innovative research infrastructure aimed at filling an existing research gap in the fields of shipping, supply chain and transport in Greece.

My role: 
● Provided support in user training seminars, assisting in the onboarding of new users and helping them to understand and utilize the services we offered.

● Supported contacts with users and data providers, ensuring that we maintained strong relationships with our partners.

● Conducted data analysis on logistic data, extracting valuable insights to inform decision-making.
Supported the development of algorithms and services, leveraging my skills in data management and software engineering.

● Participated in software design and development, playing a key role in the design and implementation of new services and features.

In this role, I honed my skills in communication, data analysis and software development. I am passionate about leveraging data to drive informed business decisions.
profile_positions.title: Data Analyst
